div1.p: Lazear thanks his mother for the birthday gifts she sent.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 30, 1897
div1.p:
I thank you very much
for the birthday wishes
& gift. I have not
decided what to get.

I was very sorry to
hear about Kall Mc.
Kelvey. We have not
heard any of the
particulars.

I forgot to send the
Times on Sunday but
I will send it now.
One can keep up with
the theatres and music
by reading the Sunday
edition.

We went to the Oratorio
Yesterday. They gave
Bethovens' “Mount of Olives”
a very beautiful thing
and Rhemberger's “Christophers”
which was very commonplace.
They are going to give 25 ct
concerts every evening in the Music
Hall, beginning May 1. They
gave them last summer.

You have not said anything
about Mrs. McCallam. Have you
given up your visit to her.
When do they expect Uncle Tom?

Give my love to Charley and Anne.
Mabel sends love
